Login Handler

app.handlers.login.handle_login(auth)[source]

Handle user login through console input.

This function prompts the user to enter their username and password, then delegates authentication to AuthService.login(). The result (either a User object or None) is returned to the caller.

Parameters:

auth (AuthService) – The authentication service responsible for validating credentials.

Returns:

The authenticated user if login is successful, otherwise None.

Return type:

User or None

Notes

  • Leading and trailing whitespace is removed from all input fields.

  • Passwords are collected in plain text from console input.

app.handlers.login.handle_logout()[source]

Log out the current user.

This function displays a logout message and returns None to signal that no user is currently authenticated.

Returns:

Always returns None to represent a logged-out session.

Return type:

None

Notes

  • This function performs no cleanup beyond user feedback.

  • The calling code should handle state reset if required.
